1.verse: Genealogical Tables -Chapter 1 -From Adam to Abraham. -Adam, Seth, Enosh,

2.verse: Kenan, Mehalalel, Jared,

3.verse: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech, Noah.

4.verse: The sons of Noah were Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

5.verse: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

6.verse: The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

7.verse: The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.

8.verse: The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

9.verse: The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, and Sabteca.The sons of Raama were Sheba and Dedan.

10.verse: Cush was the father of Nimrod, and he grew up to be a mighty warrior upon the earth.

11.verse: Mizraim was the father of Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,

12.verse: Pathrusim, Casluhim, and Caphtorim (from whom the Philistines came).

13.verse: Canaan was the father of Sidon (his firstborn), Heth,

14.verse: the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,

15.verse: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,

16.verse: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.

17.verse: The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.The sons of Aram were Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.

18.verse: Arpachshad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah was the father of Eber.

19.verse: Eber had two sons: the name of one of them was Peleg, for during his days the earth was divided, and his brother’s name was Joktan.

20.verse: Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

21.verse: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

22.verse: Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,

23.verse: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All of these were the sons of Joktan.

24.verse: Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah,

25.verse: Eber, Peleg, Reu,

26.verse: Serug, Nahor, Terah,

28.verse: From Abraham to Jacob. -The sons of Abraham were Isaac and Ishmael.

29.verse: These are their descendants: the firstborn of Ishmael was Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

31.verse: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.

32.verse: The sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine, were Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.The sons of Jokshan were Sheba and Dedan.

33.verse: The sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. These were all descendants of Keturah.

34.verse: Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac were Esau and Israel.

35.verse: The sons of Esau were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.

36.verse: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz, and by Timna there was Amalek.

37.verse: The sons of Reuel were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

38.verse: The sons of Seir were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.

39.verse: The sons of Lotan were Hori and Homam. Timna was Lotan’s sister.

40.verse: The sons of Shobal were Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon were Aiah and Anah.

41.verse: The son of Anah was Dishon.The sons of Dishon were Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.

42.verse: The sons of Ezer were Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan.The sons of Dishan were Uz and Aran.

43.verse: These were the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before a king reigned over the Israelites: Bela, the son of Beor, whose city was named Dinhabah.

44.verse: When Bela died, Jobab, the son of Zerah from Bozrah, reigned in his stead.

45.verse: When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.

46.verse: When Husham died, Hadad, the son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the land of Moab reigned in his stead. His city was named Avith.

47.verse: When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah reigned in his stead.

48.verse: When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the river reigned in his stead.

49.verse: When Shaul died, Baal-hanan, the son of Acbor, reigned in his stead.

50.verse: When Baal-hanan died, Hadad reigned in his stead. His city was named Pai, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezehab.

51.verse: Hadad also died.The chieftains of Edom were Timna, Aliah, Jetheth,

54.verse: Magdiel, and Iram. These were the chieftains of Edom.

1.verse: Chapter 2 -These were the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,

2.verse: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

3.verse: Judah. -The sons of Judah were Er, Onan, and Shelah. They were born to him by Shuah the Canaanite. Er, the firstborn of Judah, did what was evil in the sight of the Lord and he slew him.

4.verse: Tamar, his daughter-in-law, bore him Perez and Zerah, so Judah had five sons in all.

5.verse: The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.

6.verse: The sons of Zerah were Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Darda. There were five of them in all.

7.verse: The son of Carmi was Achar who troubled Israel when he violated the ban.

8.verse: The son of Ethan was Azariah.

9.verse: The sons of Hezron were Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai.

10.verse: Ram was the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab was the father of Nahshon, the leader of the Judahites.

11.verse: Nahshon was the father of Salma, and Salma was the father of Boaz.

12.verse: Boaz was the father of Obed, and Obed was the father of Jesse.

13.verse: Jesse was the father of Eliab, his firstborn, and then Abinadab, his second, Shimea, his third,

14.verse: Nethanel, his fourth, Raddai, his fifth,

15.verse: Ozem, his sixth, and David, his seventh.

16.verse: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The three sons of Zeruiah were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel.

17.verse: Abigail bore Amasa, and Amasa’s father was Jether the Ishmaelite.

18.verse: Caleb, the son of Hezron, had sons through Azubah, his wife, and through Jerioth. These were her sons: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.

19.verse: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.

20.verse: Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri was the father of Bezalel.

21.verse: Afterwards, Hezron went to the daughter of Machir, the father of Gilead. He married her when he was sixty years old, and she bore him Segub.

22.verse: Segub was the father of Jair who ruled twenty-three cities in Gilead.

23.verse: Geshur and Aram captured Havvoth-jair as well as Kenath with the towns dependent upon it, sixty towns in all. All of these were the sons of Machir, the father of Gilead.

24.verse: After Hezron died in Caleb-ephrathah, Abijah, Hezron’s wife, bore him Ashhur, the father of Tekoa.

25.verse: The sons of Jerahmeel, the firstborn of Hezron, were Ram, the firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.

26.verse: Jerahmeel had another wife whose name was Atarah. She was the mother of Onam.

27.verse: The sons of Ram, the firstborn of Jerahmeel, were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.

28.verse: The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada.The sons of Shammai were Nadab and Abishur.

29.verse: The name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail, and she bore him Ahban and Molid.

30.verse: The sons of Nadab were Seled and Appaim. Seled died without having any children.

31.verse: The son of Appaim was Ishi, and the son of Ishi was Sheshan, and the son of Sheshan was Ahlai.

32.verse: The sons of Jada, Shammai’s brother, were Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without having any children.

33.verse: The sons of Jonathan were Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.

34.verse: Now Sheshan had no sons, only daughters. He had an Egyptian slave whose name was Jarha.

35.verse: Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his slave as a wife, and she bore him Attai.

36.verse: Attai was the father of Nathan, and Nathan was the father of Zabad.

37.verse: Zabad was the father of Ephlal, and Ephlal was the father of Obed.

38.verse: Obed was the father of Jehu, and Jehu was the father of Azariah.

39.verse: Azariah was the father of Helez, and Helez was the father of Eleasah.

40.verse: Eleasah was the father of Sismai, and Sismai was the father of Shallum.

41.verse: Shallum was the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah was the father of Elishama.

42.verse: The son of Caleb, the brother of Jerahmeel, was Mesha, his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph. His son Mareshah was the father of Hebron.

43.verse: The sons of Hebron were Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.

44.verse: Shema was the father of Raham, and Raham was the father of Jorkeam.Rekem was the father of Shammai.

45.verse: Maon was the son of Shammai, and Maon was the father of Beth-zur.

46.verse: Caleb’s concubine, Ephah, bore him Haran, Moza, and Gazez.Haran was the father of Gazez.

47.verse: The sons of Jahdai were Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.

48.verse: Caleb’s concubine, Maacah, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.

49.verse: She also bore Shaaph, the father of Madmannah, and Sheva, the father of Machbenah and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Achsah.

50.verse: These were the descendants of Caleb. The sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, were Shobal, the father of Kiriath-jearim,

51.verse: Salma, the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph, the father of Beth-gader.

52.verse: The descendants of Shobal, the father of Kiriath-jearim were Haroeh, half the Manahathites,

53.verse: and the clans of Kiriath-jearim: the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites. From these came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.

54.verse: The descendants of Salma were Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, half of the Manahathites, the Zorites,

55.verse: and the clans of the scribes who dwelt in Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and the Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, who was the father of the house of Rechab.

1.verse: Chapter 3 -These were David’s sons who were born in Hebron: Amnon, the firstborn, the son of Ahinoam of Jezreel; Daniel, the second, the son of Abigail of Carmel;

2.verse: Absalom, the third, the son of Maacah, the daughter of Talmai, the king of Geshur; Adonijah, the fourth, the son of Haggith;

3.verse: Shephatiah, the fifth, the son of Abital; Ithream, the sixth, the son of Eglah.

4.verse: These six were born in Hebron where he reigned for seven years and six months. He reigned for thirty-three years in Jerusalem.

5.verse: These were the children born in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon. These four were from Bathsheba, the daughter of Ammiel.

6.verse: There were also Ibhar, Elishua, Eliphelet,

7.verse: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

8.verse: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine of them in all.

9.verse: These were the sons of David, not counting his sons by his concubines. Tamar was their sister.

10.verse: Solomon’s son was Rehoboam, Abijah his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,

11.verse: Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,

12.verse: Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,

13.verse: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,

14.verse: Amon his son, and Josiah his son.

15.verse: The sons of Josiah were Johanan his firstborn son, Jehoiakim, his second son, Zedekiah, his third son, and Shallum, his fourth son.

16.verse: The successors of Josiah were Jehoiakim, his son Jehoiachin, and Zedekiah.

17.verse: The sons of Jehoiachin the captive were Shealtiel his son,

18.verse: Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.

19.verse: The sons of Pedaiah were Zerubbabel and Shimei.The children of Zerubbabel were Meshullam, Hananiah, Shelomith, their sister,

20.verse: and five named Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed.

21.verse: The descendants of Hananiah were Pelatiah, Jeshaiah, the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, and the sons of Shecaniah.

22.verse: The son of Shecaniah was Shemaiah, and the sons of Shemaiah were Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat. There were six of them.

23.verse: The sons of Neariah were Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam. There were three of them.

24.verse: The sons of Elioenai were Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani. There were seven of them.

1.verse: Chapter 4 -The descendants of Judah were Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.

2.verse: Reaiah, the son of Shobal, was the father of Jahath, Jahath was the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the clans of the Zorathites.

3.verse: These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, Idbash, and their sister Hazzelelponi.

4.verse: Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These were the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.

5.verse: Ashur, the father of Tekoa, had two wives: Helah and Naarah.

6.verse: Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahash-tari. They were the sons of Naarah.

7.verse: The sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar, and Ethnan.

8.verse: Koz was the father of Anub, Zobebah, and the clans of Aharhel, the son of Harum.

9.verse: Jabez was the most honorable of his brothers. His mother named him Jabez because she said, “I bore him with pain.”

10.verse: Jabez called upon the God of Israel saying, “Oh that you would bless me and enlarge my territory. May your hand be with me, and keep me from harm so that I might be free from grief.” God granted what he requested.

11.verse: Chelub, Shuhah’s brother, was the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.

12.verse: Eshton was the father of Beth-rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah, the father of Ir-nahash. These were the men of Recah.

13.verse: The sons of Kenaz were Othniel and Seraiah.The sons of Othniel were Hathath and Meonothai.

14.verse: Meonothai was the father of Ophrah.Seraiah was the father of Joab, the father of Geharashim, for they were craftsmen.

15.verse: The sons of Caleb, the son of Jephunneh were Ir, Elah, and Naam.The son of Elah was Kenaz.

16.verse: The sons of Jahallelel were Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.

17.verse: The sons of Ezrah were Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. A wife of his gave birth to Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah, the father of Eshtemoa.

18.verse: His wife was from Egypt, and she gave birth to Jered, the father of Gedor, Heber, the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel, the father of Zanoah. These were the sons of Bithiah, Pharaoh’s daughter, whom Mered had married.

19.verse: The sons of Hodiah’s wife, the sister of Naham were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Maachathite.

20.verse: The sons of Shimon were Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-hanan, and Tilon.The descendants of Ishi were Zoheth and Ben-zoheth.

21.verse: The sons of Shelah, the son of Judah, were Er, the father of Lecah, Laadah, the father of Mareshah, and the clans of linen workers at Beth-ashbea,

22.verse: Jokim, the men of Cozeba, Joash, and Saraph who ruled in Moab and Jashubi-lahem. These records are from ancient times.

23.verse: They were potters who lived in Netaim and Gederah. They dwelt there and worked for the king.

24.verse: Simeon. -The sons of Simeon were Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul.

25.verse: Shallum was his son, Mibsam was his son, and Mishma was his son.

26.verse: The descendants of Mishma were Hammuel, his son, Zaccur, his son, and Shimei, his son.

27.verse: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many children so the whole clan did not become very large in Judah.

28.verse: They lived in Beer-sheba, Moladah, Hazar-shual,

31.verse: Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susim, Beth-biri, and Shaaraim. These were their cities up to the time of the reign of David.

32.verse: Their dependent villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, Ashan, five of them in all,

33.verse: as well as all of the villages that surrounded these cities up to Baal. These were their settlements and their genealogies.

34.verse: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah, the son of Amaziah,

35.verse: Joel, Jehu, the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,

36.verse: as well as Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,

37.verse: and Ziza, the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah—

38.verse: these were the names of the leaders of their clans. Their families increased greatly.

39.verse: They traveled toward the entrance of Gedor on the east side of the valley, to seek pastures for their flocks.

40.verse: They found good, rich pastures and a spacious land that was quiet and peaceful. Some Hamites had lived there from ancient times.

41.verse: The men whose names are written here arrived during the days of Hezekiah, the king of Judah. They attacked those living there as well as the Meunites who were found there. They wiped them out, as is still true today. They dwelt in their place for there were pastures for their flocks there.

42.verse: About five hundred of the Simeonites invaded the hill country of Seir led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.

43.verse: They killed the rest of the Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there up to the present.

1.verse: Chapter 5 -Reuben. -The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn, but when he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph, the son of Israel. For this reason he could not be listed in the genealogy according to his birthright.

2.verse: Though Judah was the strongest of the brothers and a ruler came through him, the birthright belonged to Joseph.)

3.verse: The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

4.verse: The descendants of Joel were Shemaiah, his son, Gog, his son, Shimei, his son,

5.verse: Micah, his son, Reaiah, his son, Baal, his son,

6.verse: and Beerah, his son, whom Tiglath-pileser, the king of Assyria, carried off into exile. He was the leader of the Reubenites.

7.verse: These were their brethren by their clans, listed according to the generations of their genealogy. Jeiel, their leader, Zechariah,

8.verse: and Bela, the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel. They dwelt in the area that ran from Aroer to Nebo and Baal-meon.

9.verse: To the east, they lived on the edge of the desert that runs up to the Euphrates River because their herds had grown numerous in the land of Gilead.

10.verse: During the days of Saul they fought against the Hagrites who fell at their hands. They lived in their dwellings to the east of Gilead.

11.verse: Gad. -The Gadites lived alongside of them in the land of Bashan up to Salecah.

12.verse: Joel was their leader, Shapham the next, then Janai, Shaphat, and Bashan.

13.verse: Their brethren, by their ancestral clans, were Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber. There were seven of them in all.

14.verse: These were the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.

15.verse: Ahi, the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was the leader of the clan.

16.verse: The Gadites lived in Gilead, in Bashan, all of their villages, and all throughout the pastures of Sharon.

17.verse: All of these were entered in the genealogies during the reigns of Jotham, the king of Judah, and Jeroboam, the king of Israel.

18.verse: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and one-half of the tribe of Manasseh had forty-four thousand, seven hundred and sixty trained warriors armed with shield, sword, and bow who went out to battle.

19.verse: They fought against the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.

20.verse: They helped in fighting against them, and the Lord delivered the Hagrites and those who were with them into their hands for they had cried out to God all throughout the battle. He responded to them because they had put their trust in him.

21.verse: They seized their livestock: fifty thousand camels, two hundred thousand sheep, and two thousand donkeys. They also took one hundred thousand captives.

22.verse: Many others were killed, falling because it was God’s battle. They then dwelt there in their place until the time of the Exile.

23.verse: The Half-tribe of Manasseh. -The one-half of the tribe of Manasseh who dwelt in the land of Bashan up to Baal-hermon, that is Senir, or Mount Hermon, grew numerous.

24.verse: These were the leaders of their ancestral clans: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were brave warriors, famous, and the leaders of their ancestral clans,

25.verse: but they betrayed the God of their fathers, prostituting themselves with the gods of the various peoples of the land whom God had destroyed before them.

26.verse: Therefore the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul, the king of Assyria (that is, the spirit of Tiglath-pileser, the king of Assyria). He led away the Reubenites, the Gadites, and one-half of the tribe of Manasseh and brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and to the Gozan River where they are up to the present.

1.verse: Chapter 6 -The sons of Levi were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

2.verse: The names of the sons of Gershon were Libni and Shimei.

3.verse: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

4.verse: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi.These were the ancestral clans of the Levites.

5.verse: From Gershon: Libni, his son, Jahath, his son, Zimmah, his son,

6.verse: Joah, his son, Iddo, his son, Zerah, his son, and Jeatherai, his son.

7.verse: The descendants of Kohath were Amminadab, his son, Korah, his son, Assir, his son,

8.verse: Elkanah, his son, Ebiasaph, his son, Assir, his son,

9.verse: Tahath, his son, Uriel, his son, Uzziah, his son, and Shaul, his son.

10.verse: The descendants of Elkanah were Amasai, Ahimoth,

11.verse: Elkanah, his son, Zophai, his son, Nahath, his son,

12.verse: Eliab, his son, Jeroham, his son, Elkanah, his son, and Samuel, his son.

13.verse: The sons of Samuel were Joel, his firstborn, and Abijah, his second.

14.verse: The descendants of Merari were: Mahli, Libni, his son, Shimei, his son, Uzzah, his son,

15.verse: Shimea, his son, Haggiah, his son, and Asaiah, his son.

16.verse: These are the ones whom David assigned to sing in the shrine of the Lord after the Ark was placed there.

17.verse: Their ministry was to sing before the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, until Solomon built the temple of the Lord in Jerusalem. They also performed their other duties according to their responsibilities.

18.verse: These are the men who served along with their children: from the Kohathites: Heman, the singer, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,

19.verse: the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,

20.verse: the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,

21.verse: the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,

22.verse: the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,

23.verse: the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.

24.verse: There was also his brother Asaph who served at his right side. Asaph, the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,

25.verse: the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah,

26.verse: the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,

27.verse: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,

28.verse: the son of Jahath, the son of Gershon, the son of Levi.

29.verse: The Merarites, their brethren, served on his left: Ethan, the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,

30.verse: the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,

31.verse: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,

32.verse: the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.

33.verse: Their fellow Levites were appointed to various types of service in the tabernacle, the shrine of the Lord.

34.verse: But Aaron and his descendants were the ones who offered sacrifices on the altar for burnt offerings and the altar of incense. They also performed all of the work needed in the Holy of Holies where they made atonement for Israel in accordance with everything that Moses, the servant of God, had commanded.

35.verse: These were the descendants of Aaron: Eleazar, his son, Phinehas, his son, Abishua, his son,

36.verse: Bukki, his son, Uzzi, his son, Zerahiah, his son,

37.verse: Meraioth, his son, Amariah, his son, Ahitub, his son,

38.verse: Zadok, his son, and Ahimaaz, his son.

39.verse: These were the sites assigned as their dwelling places throughout the land. They were assigned to the descendants of Aaron from the Kohathite clan because this was their allotment.

40.verse: They were given Hebron in the land of Judah along with its surrounding pastures.

41.verse: But the fields and the villages that surrounded the city were given to Caleb, the son of Jephunneh.

42.verse: The descendants of Aaron were given Hebron (which was a city of refuge), Libnah with its pastures, Jattir, Eshtemoa with its pastures,

43.verse: Hilen with its pastures, Debir with its pastures,

44.verse: Ashan with its pastures, Jetta with its pastures, and Beth-shemesh with its pastures.

45.verse: From the tribe of Benjamin they were given Gibeon with its pastures, Geba with its pastures, Almon with its pastures, and Anathoth with its pastures. There were thirteen cities for their clans.

46.verse: The rest of the Kohathites were allotted ten cities from the clans of one-half of the tribe of Manasseh.

47.verse: The descendants of Gershon, clan by clan, were allotted thirteen cities from the tribe of Issachar, the tribe of Asher, the tribe of Naphtali, and the part of the tribe of Manasseh living in Bashan.

48.verse: The descendants of Merari, clan by clan, were allotted twelve cities from the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad, and the tribe of Zebulun.

49.verse: The Israelites gave the Levites these cities along with their pastures.

50.verse: They were allotted these previously named cities from the tribe of the Judahites, the tribe of the Simeonites, and the tribe of the Benjaminites.

51.verse: Some of the remaining Kohathites were given cities from the territory of the tribe of Ephraim.

52.verse: In the hill country of Ephraim they were given Shechem (a city of refuge) with its pastures, Gezer with its pastures,

53.verse: Jokmeam with its pastures, Beth-horon with its pastures,

54.verse: Aijalon with its pastures, and Gath-rimmon with its pastures.

55.verse: The rest of the Kohathite clans were given Aner with its pastures and Bileam with its pastures from one-half of the tribe of Manasseh.

56.verse: The Gershonites were given the following from the clan of one-half of the tribe of Manasseh: Golan in Bashan with its pastures, and Ashtaroth with its pastures.

57.verse: From the tribe of Issachar they were given Kedesh with its pastures, Daberath with its pastures,

58.verse: Ramoth with its pastures, and Anem with its pastures.

59.verse: From the tribe of Asher they were given Mashal with its pastures, Abdon with its pastures,

60.verse: Hukok with its pastures, and Rehob with its pastures.

61.verse: From the tribe of Naphtali they were given Kedesh in Galilee with its pastures, Hammon with its pastures, and Kiriathaim with its pastures.

62.verse: The rest of the Merarites were given Rimmon with its pastures, and Tabor with its pastures from the tribe of Zebulun.

63.verse: On the other side of the Jordan, to the east of Jericho, they were given from the tribe of Reuben: Bezer in the desert with its pastures, Jahzah with its pastures,

64.verse: Kedemoth with its pastures, Mephaath with its pastures.

65.verse: From the tribe of Gad they were given Ramoth in Gilead with its pastures, Mahanaim with its pastures,

66.verse: Heshbon with its pastures, and Jazer with its pastures.

1.verse: Chapter 7 -Issachar. -The sons of Issachar were Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron. There were four of them in all.

2.verse: The sons of Tola were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Shemuel, all leaders of their ancestral clans. During the reign of David, the descendants of Tola had twenty-two thousand, six hundred brave warriors in their generations.

3.verse: The son of Uzzi was Izrahiah. The sons of Izrahiah were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah. All five of them were leaders.

4.verse: According to the generations of their ancestral clans, they had thirty-six thousand warriors, for they had many wives and children.

5.verse: There were eighty-seven thousand brave warriors in all of their genealogies from among the brethren who belonged to the clans of Issachar.

6.verse: Benjamin. -The sons of Benjamin were Bela, Becher, and Jediael. There were three of them in all.

7.verse: The sons of Bela were Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri. They were the five leaders of the ancestral clans. There were twenty-two thousand and thirty-four brave warriors according to their genealogies.

8.verse: The sons of Becher were Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All of these were the sons of Becher.

9.verse: These are the genealogies of the leaders of the ancestral clans and their twenty thousand, two hundred brave warriors.

10.verse: The son of Jediael was Bilhan. The sons of Bilhan were Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.

11.verse: All of the sons of Jediael were leaders of the brave warriors, of whom there were seventeen thousand, two hundred ready for battle.

12.verse: The Shuppites and the Huppites were descendants of Ir, and the Hushim were descendants of Dan.

13.verse: Naphtali and Manasseh. -The sons of Naphtali were Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum. They were descendants of Bilhah.

14.verse: The descendants of Manasseh included Ashriel who was a descendant of his Aramean concubine. She bore Machir, the father of Gilead.

15.verse: Machir took a wife from among the Huppites and the Shuppites. His sister’s name was Maacah. Another of his descendants was Zelophehad who only had daughters.

16.verse: Maacah, the wife of Machir, gave birth to a son named Peresh. His brother’s name was Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.

17.verse: The son of Ulam was Bedan. These were the descendants of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.

18.verse: His sister was Hammolecheth. She gave birth to Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.

19.verse: The sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.

20.verse: Ephraim. -The descendants of Ephraim were Shuthelah, Bered, his son, Tahath, his son, Eleadah, his son, Tahath, his son,

21.verse: Zabad, his son, and Shuthelah, his son. Ezer and Elead were killed by men born in the land of Gath when they led a raid to take away their cattle.

22.verse: Their father Ephraim mourned for them for a long time, and his relatives came to comfort him.

23.verse: Then he slept with his wife again, and she conceived and bore a son whose name was Beriah because misfortune had visited his family.

24.verse: His daughter was Sheerah. She built upper and lower Beth-horon as well as Uzzen-sheerah.

25.verse: Rephah was his son as well as Resheph. There was Telah, his son, Tahan, his son,

26.verse: Ladan, his son, Ammihud, his son, Elishama, his son,

27.verse: Nun, his son, and Joshua, his son.

28.verse: Now their possessions and their dwelling places included Bethel and the towns dependent upon it, to the east Naaran, to the west Gezer and the towns dependent upon it, Shechem and the towns dependent upon it, Ayyah and the towns dependent upon it.

29.verse: Near the boundary with Manasseh there were Beth-shean and the towns dependent upon it, Taanach and the towns dependent upon it, Megiddo and the towns dependent upon it, and Dor with its towns. The descendants of Joseph, the son of Israel, dwelt in them.

30.verse: Asher. -The sons of Asher were Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and their sister Serah.

31.verse: The sons of Beriah were Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.

32.verse: Heber was the father of Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and their sister Shua.

33.verse: The sons of Japhlet were Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These were the children of Japhlet.

34.verse: The sons of Shomer were Ahi, Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.

35.verse: The sons of his brother Hotham were Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.

36.verse: The sons of Zophah were Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,

37.verse: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.

38.verse: The sons of Jether were Jephunneh, Pispa, and Ara.

39.verse: The sons of Ulla were Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.

40.verse: These were all the descendants of Asher, the leaders of the ancestral clans, the mighty brave warriors, and the main leaders. In their genealogies there were twenty-six thousand warriors ready for battle.

1.verse: Chapter 8 -Benjamin. -Benjamin was the father of Bela, his firstborn, Ashbel, his second, Aharah, his third,

2.verse: Nohah, his fourth, and Rapha, his fifth.

3.verse: The sons of Bela were Addar, Gera, the father of Ehud,

4.verse: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,

5.verse: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.

6.verse: These were the sons of Ehud. They were the leaders of the ancestral clans of those who lived in Geba. They forced them to move to Manahath:

7.verse: Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera, who forced them to move. He was the father of Uzza and Ahihud.

8.verse: Shaharaim had children in the land of Moab after he sent away Hushim and Baara, his wives.

9.verse: Through Hodesh, his wife, he was the father of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,

10.verse: Jeuz, Sachia, and Mirmah. They were his sons and leaders of the ancestral clans.

11.verse: Through Hushim he was the father of Abitub and Elpaal.

12.verse: The sons of Elpaal were Eber, Misham, Shemed, who built Ono and Lod and the towns dependent upon them,

13.verse: Beriah, and Shema. They were the leaders of the ancestral clans of those who lived in Aijalon and who drove out the inhabitants of Gath.

14.verse: Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,

15.verse: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,

16.verse: Michael, Ispah, and Joha were the sons of Beriah.

17.verse: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,

18.verse: Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.

19.verse: Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi,

20.verse: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,

21.verse: Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.

22.verse: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,

23.verse: Abdon, Zichri, Hanan,

24.verse: Hananiah, Elam, Antothijah,

25.verse: Iphdeiah, and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.

26.verse: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,

27.verse: Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zichri were the sons of Jeroham.

28.verse: These were the leaders of the ancestral clans by their leader. They dwelt in Jerusalem.

29.verse: Now the father of Gibeon, whose wife’s name was Maacah, lived in Gibeon.

30.verse: His firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,

32.verse: and Mikloth, who became the father of Shimeah. They dwelt near their brethren in Jerusalem, living with them.

33.verse: Ner was the father of Kish, and Kish was the father of Saul.Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-baal.

34.verse: The son of Jonathan was Meri-baal, and Meri-baal was the father of Micah.

35.verse: The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.

36.verse: Ahaz was the father of Jehoaddah. Jehoaddah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri.Zimri was the father of Moza.

37.verse: Moza was the father of Binea, Raphah was his son, Eleasah was his son, and Azel was his son.

38.verse: Azel had six sons whose names were Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All of these were sons of Azel.

39.verse: The sons of Eshek, his brother, were Ulam, his firstborn, Jeush, his second, and Eliphelet, his third.

40.verse: The sons of Ulam were brave warriors, archers. They had many sons and grandsons, one hundred and fifty in all. These were all of the descendants of Benjamin.

1.verse: Chapter 9 -Thus all of Israel was recorded by its generations, for behold, it was inscribed in the book of the kings of Israel.Judah was carried away into Babylon for its unfaithfulness.

2.verse: The first inhabitants who dwelt in their possessions in their cities were the Israelites, the priests, the Levites, and the temple slaves.

3.verse: Among the Judahites who dwelt in Jerusalem along with the Benjaminites, Ephraimites, and Manassehites were:

4.verse: Uthai, the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, a descendant of Perez, the son of Judah.

5.verse: From the Shelanites there was Asaiah, the firstborn, and his sons.

6.verse: From the sons of Zerah there was Jeuel and their brethren, six hundred and ninety of them.

7.verse: From the Benjaminites there were Sallu, the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah,

8.verse: Ibneiah, the son of Jeroham, Elah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri, and Meshullam, the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah,

9.verse: along with their kinsmen, according to their generations. There were nine hundred fifty-six of them. All of these were leaders of their ancestral clans.

10.verse: From the priests there were Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jachin,

11.verse: and Azariah, the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the chief custodian of the temple.

12.verse: There were also Adaiah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasai, the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer.

13.verse: Their brethren, who were the leaders of the ancestral clans, included one thousand, seven hundred and sixty men. They were all capable men who were responsible for ministry in the temple of the Lord.

14.verse: From the Levites there were Shemaiah, the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, who was a Merarite.

15.verse: There were Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah, the son of Mica, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph.

16.verse: There were Obadiah, the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah, the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah. They lived in the village of the Netophathites.

17.verse: The gatekeepers were Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their brethren. Shallum was their leader.

18.verse: They have been stationed at the king’s gate on the east up to the present day. They were the gatekeepers of the Levites.

19.verse: Shallum, the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brethren from the ancestral clan of the Korahites were the gatekeepers at the entrance to the tabernacle just as their ancestors had been the gatekeepers to the entrance of the dwelling place of the Lord.

20.verse: In former days, Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, had been their leader, and the Lord had been with him.

21.verse: Zechariah, the son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance to the tent of meeting.

22.verse: There were two hundred and twelve of those who had been chosen to be gatekeepers. They are registered by their family history in the villages. David and Samuel the seer had assigned them to their responsibilities.

23.verse: They and their children were responsible for guarding the gates of the temple of the Lord (the shrine of the tabernacle) by turns.

24.verse: The gatekeepers served in the four directions of the east, the west, the north, and the south.

25.verse: Their brethren who lived in the villages would come up to join them for a period of seven days from time to time.

26.verse: There were four Levites who held the office of chief gatekeepers. They were responsible for the chambers and the treasuries of the temple of the Lord.

27.verse: They would spend the night stationed around the temple of God because they were responsible for it, and then they would open it each morning.

28.verse: Some of them were responsible for the vessels used in the liturgy, and they would count them when they were brought in and taken out.

29.verse: Others were assigned responsibility for the furniture and all of the other things used in the sanctuary as well as the flour, wine, oil, incense, and spices.

30.verse: Some of the priests were responsible for mixing the spices in the ointments.

31.verse: There was a certain Levite, Mattithiah, the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, who was responsible for the baking of the bread.

32.verse: Some of the Korahites, their brethren, were in charge of preparing the shewbread every Sabbath.

33.verse: Those who were singers, the leaders of their ancestral clans of Levites, would stay in the chambers. They were free from other responsibilities, for they were busy working day and night.

34.verse: These were all leaders of the ancestral clans of the Levites, leaders according to their generations, and they dwelt in Jerusalem.

35.verse: The History of David -Genealogy of Saul. -Jeiel, the father of Gibeon, dwelt in Gibeon. His wife’s name was Maacah.

36.verse: His firstborn was Abdon, then there were Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,

38.verse: Mikloth was the father of Shimeam. They lived near their brethren, their brethren who lived in Jerusalem.

39.verse: Ner was the father of Kish, and Kish was the father of Saul.Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-baal.

40.verse: The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal, who was the father of Micah.

41.verse: The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.

42.verse: Ahaz was the father of Jarah, and Jarah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri.Zimri was the father of Moza.

43.verse: Moza was the father of Binea, Rephaiah was his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.

44.verse: Azel had six sons, and these are their names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. They were the sons of Azel.

1.verse: Chapter 10 -Saul’s Death and Burial. -Now the Philistines attacked Israel, and Israel fled from the Philistines. Many fell and were killed at Mount Gilboa.

2.verse: The Philistines pursued Saul and his sons. The Philistines killed Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua, the sons of Saul.

3.verse: The fighting around Saul became fierce when the archers hit him. The archers wounded him.

4.verse: Saul said to his armor-bearer, “Take out your sword and run me through lest these uncircumcised men come and mock me.” But he was terrified, so Saul took out a sword and fell on it.

5.verse: When his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he, too, fell on his sword and died.

6.verse: Saul and his three sons died, and his whole household died with him.

7.verse: When all the Israelites in the valley saw that they had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their cities and fled. The Philistines came and occupied them.

8.verse: The next day the Philistines came up to strip the dead, and they found Saul and his sons who had fallen on Mount Gilboa.

9.verse: They stripped him, taking his head and his armor. They sent word throughout the surrounding land of the Philistines proclaiming the news among their idols and their people.

10.verse: They placed his armor in the shrine of their gods, hanging his head in the shrine of Dagon.

11.verse: When all the people in Jabesh-gilead heard about everything that the Philistines had done to Saul,

12.verse: all of their brave men rose up and took away the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons. They brought them to Jabesh and buried their bones under the oak tree in Jabesh. They then fasted for seven days.

13.verse: Saul died because of the transgressions that he had committed against the Lord, against the word of the Lord which he did not observe, for he even consulted with a medium to make inquiry.

14.verse: He did not inquire from the Lord. He slew him and turned the kingdom over to David, the son of Jesse.

1.verse: Chapter 11 -David Becomes King. -All of Israel gathered before David in Hebron and they said, “Behold, we are your bone and your flesh.

2.verse: Moreover, in times past, even when Saul was the king, you led Israel out and brought them in. The Lord, your God, said to you, ‘You will shepherd my people Israel. You will be the ruler of my people Israel.’ ”

3.verse: When all of the elders of Israel came to the king in Hebron, he made a covenant before the Lord with them at Hebron. They anointed David as king over Israel, fulfilling the word of the Lord that had been spoken by Samuel.

4.verse: David Conquers Jerusalem. -David and all of Israel went to Jerusalem, that is, Jebus. The Jebusites were the inhabitants of that land.

5.verse: The inhabitants of Jebus said to David, “You will never enter.” Nevertheless, David captured the citadel of Zion, that is, the City of David.

6.verse: David had said, “Whoever leads the attack on the Jebusites will be the commander-in-chief.” Joab, the son of Zeruiah, led it so he became the commander.

7.verse: David lived in the citadel, and thus it was called the City of David.

8.verse: He built up the city around it, from Millo to the surrounding walls. Joab repaired the rest of the city.

9.verse: David’s power grew and grew, for the Lord of hosts was with him.

10.verse: David’s Brave Warriors. -These were the leaders of David’s brave warriors. They made him and his kingdom strong, with all of Israel making him king, according to the word of the Lord about Israel.

11.verse: This is the list of David’s brave warriors: Ishbaal, a Hachmonite, was the leader of the captains. He raised up his spear against three hundred men at one time and he slew them.

12.verse: After him there was Eleazar, the son of Dodo, who was one of the three mighty men.

13.verse: He was with David at Pas-dammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. It was a field that was planted with barley, and the people fled before the Philistines.

14.verse: They took their stand in the middle of the field. They defended it and slew the Philistines, for the Lord brought about a great deliverance.

15.verse: Now three of the thirty captains came down to the cave of Adullam to be with David, while the army of the Philistines was camped in the Valley of Rephaim.

16.verse: David was in the stronghold, and there was a Philistine outpost in Bethlehem.

17.verse: David longed for water so he said, “Oh that you would give me some water to drink from the well that is at the gate of Bethlehem.”

18.verse: The Three broke through the lines of the Philistine army and drew water from the well at the gate to Bethlehem. They took it and brought it to David, but David would not drink it. He poured it out before the Lord.

19.verse: He said, “Far be it from me, my God, that I should do such a thing, that I would drink the blood of these men, for they risked their lives to bring it back.” Therefore, he would not drink it.These are the deeds of the Three brave warriors.

20.verse: Abishai, the brother of Joab, was the leader of the Three. He raised up his spear against three hundred men and he slew them. He was the most famous of the Three.

21.verse: He was twice as honored as the Three, for he was their captain, even though he was not one of the Three.

22.verse: Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, was a brave warrior who performed many deeds. He was from Kabzeel. He slew two of Moab’s mightiest men. He also descended into a pit on a snowy day and killed a lion.

23.verse: He also slew a very tall Egyptian who was five cubits tall. The Egyptian had a spear in his hand that was as big as a weaver’s beam. He attacked him with his staff, and he snatched the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand and slew him with his own spear.

24.verse: These were the deeds of Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada. He was as famous as the Three Brave Warriors.

25.verse: He was more greatly honored than any of the Thirty, but he did not belong to the Three. David assigned him to be in charge of his bodyguard.

26.verse: The brave warriors were: Asahel, the brother of Joab; Elhanan, the son of Dodo from Bethlehem;

27.verse: Shammoth the Harorite; Helez the Pelonite;

28.verse: Ira, the son of Ikkesh from Tekoa; Abiezer from Anathoth;

29.verse: Sibbecai the Hushathite; Ilai the Ahohite;

30.verse: Maharai the Netophathite; Heled, the son of Baanah the Netophathite;

31.verse: Ithai, the son of Ribai from Gibeah in Benjamin; Benaiah the Pirathonite;

32.verse: Hurai, from the Wadi of Gaash; Abiel the Arbathite;

33.verse: Azmaveth the Baharumite; Eliahba the Shaalbonite;

34.verse: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite; Jonathan, the son of Shagee the Hararite;

35.verse: Ahiam, the son of Sacar the Hararite; Eliphal, the son of Ur;

36.verse: Hepher the Mecherathite; Ahijah the Pelonite;

37.verse: Hezro the Carmelite; Naarai, the son of Ezbai;

38.verse: Joel, the brother of Nathan; Mibhar, the son of Hagri;

39.verse: Zelek the Ammonite; Naharai the Berothite, the armor-bearer of Joab, the son of Zeruiah;

40.verse: Ira the Ithrite; Gareb the Ithrite;

41.verse: Uriah the Hittite; Zabad, the son of Ahlai;

42.verse: Adina, the son of Shiza the Reubenite, who was the leader of the Reubenites and the Thirty with him;

43.verse: Hanan, the son of Maacah; Joshaphat the Mithnite;

44.verse: Uzzia the Ashterathite; Shama and Jeiel, the sons of Hotham the Aroerite;

45.verse: Jediael, the son of Shimri; his brother Joha the Tizite;

46.verse: Eliel the Mahavite; Jeribai and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam; Ithmah the Moabite;

47.verse: Eliel; Obed; and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.

1.verse: Chapter 12 -David’s First Followers. -These were the men who came to David while he was at Ziklag, a fugitive from Saul, the son of Kish. They were the brave warriors who helped him in battle.

2.verse: They were armed with bows, and they could sling stones or shoot arrows from a bow with their right hand or their left. They were kinsmen of Saul from Benjamin.

3.verse: Ahiezer was their leader, and then Joash, who were the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite. There were Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; Beracah; Jehu the Anathothite;

4.verse: Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a brave warrior from among the Thirty and the leader of the Thirty; Jeremiah; Jahaziel; Johanan; Jozabad the Gederathite;

5.verse: Eluzai; Jerimoth; Bealiah; Shemariah; Shephatiah the Haruphite;

6.verse: Elkanah; Isshiah; Azarel; Joezer; Jashobeam the Korahite;

7.verse: and Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham from Gedor.

8.verse: Some Gadites joined David in the wilderness. They were brave men, warriors ready for battle, able to handle the shield and the spear. Their faces were as fierce as the faces of lions, and they were as swift as gazelles upon the mountains.

9.verse: Ezer was the first; Obadiah was the second; Eliab was the third;

10.verse: Mishmannah was the fourth; Jeremiah was the fifth;

11.verse: Attai was the sixth; Eliel was the seventh;

12.verse: Johanan was the eighth; Elzabad was the ninth;

13.verse: Jeremiah the tenth; and Machbannai the eleventh.

14.verse: These Gadites were captains of the army. The weakest of them was worth a hundred, the strongest was worth a thousand.

15.verse: They were crossing over the Jordan during the first month when it was overflowing its banks, and they put to flight everyone who was living in the valleys to the east and the west.

16.verse: Some other Benjaminites and Judahites also went out to David in his stronghold.

17.verse: David went out to meet them and he said to them, “If you have come to me in peace, to help me, then your heart will be one with my heart. But if you are here to betray me to my enemies even though my hands are innocent, may the God of our fathers see it and rebuke you.”

18.verse: The Spirit then came upon Amasai, the leader of the captains, and he said,“We are yours, David.We will be with you, O son of Jesse.May it go well with you,and may it go well with those who help you,for your God will help you.”David received them and made them captains of his raiding parties.

19.verse: Some men from Manasseh went over to David when he went to the Philistines to fight against Saul. He, however, did not help them because the lords of the Philistines had discussed it and sent him away saying, “It would cost us our heads if he were to defect to his master Saul.”

20.verse: These were the men of Manasseh who went over to him in Ziklag: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai. They were captains of the thousands in Manasseh.

21.verse: They helped David fight against the raiding parties, and they were brave warriors, all of them captains of the army.

22.verse: From that time on, more men would arrive daily to help David until he had a large army, like an army of God.

23.verse: Assembly at Hebron. -These are the numbers of the bands of those who came to David in Hebron ready for battle. They turned Saul’s kingdom over to him, according to the word of the Lord.

24.verse: From Judah, there were six thousand, eight hundred men bearing shield and spear, ready for battle.

25.verse: From Simeon there were seven thousand, one hundred brave warriors, ready for battle.

26.verse: From Levi there were four thousand, six hundred men.

27.verse: These included Jehoiada, the leader of the Aaronites, and with him there were three thousand, seven hundred men.

28.verse: There was Zadok, a young man who was a brave warrior, with twenty-two captains from his father’s household.

29.verse: From Benjamin, Saul’s kinsmen, there were three thousand men, most of whom had remained faithful to the house of Saul until then.

30.verse: From Ephraim there were twenty thousand, eight hundred brave warriors who were famous in their ancestral clans.

31.verse: There were eighteen thousand men from one-half of the tribe of Manasseh. They were designated by name to go and make David king.

32.verse: From Issachar there were two hundred leaders with their brethren under them. They understood well the time and what Israel should do.

33.verse: From Zebulun there were fifty thousand experienced fighters ready to go into battle. They had every different type of weapon, and they were of undivided loyalty.

34.verse: From Naphtali there were one thousand captains along with thirty-seven thousand men armed with shield and spear.

35.verse: From Dan there were twenty-eight thousand, six hundred men, ready for battle.

36.verse: From Asher there were forty thousand experienced fighters ready for battle.

37.verse: From the eastern side of the Jordan, there were one hundred and twenty thousand men armed with every different type of weapon from Reuben, Gad, and one-half of the tribe of Manasseh.

38.verse: All of these were well-trained fighting men. They came to Hebron for they wholeheartedly wanted to make David king over all of Israel. The rest of Israel was in agreement to make David king.

39.verse: They spent three days eating and drinking with David (for their brethren had provided provisions for them).

40.verse: Their neighbors from as far away as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali brought food on their donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen: plentiful supplies of flour, fig cakes, raisin cakes, wine, oil, oxen, and sheep, for joy had spread throughout Israel.

1.verse: Chapter 13 -The Ark Is Returned to Jerusalem. -After David consulted with the captains of the thousands and the hundreds and with all of the leaders,

2.verse: he spoke to the assembly of Israel, saying, “If you feel that this is good, for the Lord, our God, has willed it, then let us send messengers to the rest of our brethren throughout the land of Israel, including the priests and the Levites who are in their cities and pastures, so that they can come and join us.

3.verse: Let us bring the Ark of God to where we are, for they did not make inquiry at it during the reign of Saul.”

4.verse: The whole assembly said that they would do this, for all of the people considered it to be the right thing to do.

5.verse: David assembled all of Israel, from the Shihor in Egypt up to Lebo-hamath, to bring the Ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.

6.verse: David and all of the Israelites with him went to Baalah of Judah, that is, Kiriath-jearim, to bring up from there the Ark of God, the Lord, who dwells between the cherubim where his name is proclaimed.

7.verse: They carried the Ark of the Lord on a new cart to the house of Abinadab. Uzzah and Ahio drove the cart.

8.verse: David and all of Israel played before the Lord with all their might, singing and playing on the harps, lyres, tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.

9.verse: When they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzzah reached out his hand to grab the Ark because the oxen had stumbled.

10.verse: The Lord’s anger blazed against Uzzah, and he struck him down because he had touched the Ark. He died there before the Lord.

11.verse: David was disturbed because of the Lord’s outburst against Uzzah, which is why that place is called Perez-uzzah up to the present day.

12.verse: David was afraid of the Lord that day, saying, “How shall I bring the Ark of God to myself?”

13.verse: He did not take the Ark with him into the City of David. He had it carried into the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.

14.verse: The Ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom, in his house, for three months. The Lord blessed the house of Obed-edom and all that he owned.

1.verse: Chapter 14 -David in Jerusalem. -Now Hiram, the king of Tyre, sent messengers to David, along with cedar wood, masons, and carpenters to build him a palace.

2.verse: David knew that the Lord had confirmed him as king over Israel and that his kingdom had been highly exalted for the sake of his people Israel.

3.verse: In Jerusalem David married more wives, and he had more sons and daughters.

4.verse: These were the names of the children who were born to him there: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,

5.verse: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,

6.verse: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

7.verse: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.

8.verse: David’s Victory over the Philistines. -When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed as king over all of Israel, all of the Philistines went up to seek out David. David heard about it and went out to meet them.

9.verse: The Philistines arrived and spread themselves out in the Valley of Rephaim.

10.verse: David inquired of God, saying, “Shall I go out against the Philistines? Will you deliver them into my hands?” The Lord answered them, “Go up, I will deliver them into your hands.”

11.verse: They went up to Baal-perazim, and there David defeated them. David said, “God has broken my enemies by my hand, just as when waters break forth.” This is why that place is called Baal-perazim.

12.verse: They had left their gods there, and David gave an order that they be burned in the fire.

13.verse: Still another time the Philistines came and spread themselves out in the valley.

14.verse: David inquired of God again, and God said to him, “Do not attack them directly, but circle around them and attack them from behind the balsam trees.

15.verse: As soon as you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, go forth into battle, for God has gone forth before you to strike down the Philistines.”

16.verse: David did as God had commanded him, and they struck down the army of the Philistines from Gibeon all the way to Gezer.

17.verse: David’s fame spread throughout every land, and the Lord caused all of the nations to fear him.

1.verse: Chapter 15 -Carrying the Ark to Jerusalem. -After David had constructed buildings for himself in the City of David, he prepared a place for the Ark of God, pitching a tent for it.

2.verse: David then said, “No one can carry the Ark of God except the Levites. The Lord has chosen them to carry the Ark of God and to minister to him forever.”

3.verse: David assembled all of Israel in Jerusalem to bring the Ark of the Lord to the place that he had prepared for it.

4.verse: David assembled the descendants of Aaron and the Levites.

5.verse: From the descendants of Kohath, there were Uriel, their leader, and one hundred and twenty of his brethren.

6.verse: From the descendants of Merari, there were Asaiah, their leader, and two hundred and twenty of his brethren.

7.verse: From the descendants of Gershon, there were Joel, their leader, and one hundred and thirty of his brethren.

8.verse: From the descendants of Elizaphan, there were Shemaiah, their leader, and two hundred of his brethren.

9.verse: From the descendants of Hebron, there were Eliel, their leader, and eighty of his brethren.

10.verse: From the descendants of Uzziel, there were Amminadab, their leader, and one hundred and twelve of his brethren.

11.verse: David summoned Zadok and Abiathar, the priests, and Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab the Levites.

12.verse: He said to them, “You are the leaders of the ancestral clans of the Levites. Sanctify yourselves and your brethren so that you might bring the Ark of the Lord, the God of Israel, to the place that I have prepared for it.

13.verse: It is because you did not bring it up the first time that the Lord burst forth against us, for we did not inquire of him about the proper order.”

14.verse: The priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the Ark of the Lord, the God of Israel.

15.verse: The descendants of the Levites carried the Ark of God by its poles on their shoulders, as Moses had commanded, according to the word of the Lord.

16.verse: David spoke to the leaders of the Levites to appoint their brethren as singers, lifting their voices up with joy, and accompanied by music played on the lyres, harps, and cymbals.

17.verse: So the Levites appointed Heman, the son of Joel, and one of his brethren, Asaph, the son of Berechiah, and from among the brethren of the Merarites, Ethan, the son of Kushaiah.

18.verse: With them, there were their brethren of second rank: Zechariah, Uzziel, Shemira-moth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel, the gatekeepers.

19.verse: The musicians Heman, Asaph, and Ethan were to play upon bronze cymbals.

20.verse: Zechariah, Uzziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah were to play the lyres according to Alamoth.

21.verse: Matthithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah were to play upon harps according to the Sheminith.

22.verse: Chenaniah, the leader of the Levites dedicated to music, directed the music, for he was skillful at it.

23.verse: Berechiah and Elkanah were the gatekeepers for the Ark.

24.verse: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, were to blow the trumpets before the Ark of God. Obed-edom and Jeiel were also gatekeepers for the Ark.

25.verse: The Ark Comes to Jerusalem. -David, the elders of Israel, and the captains of the thousands went to bring the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord up from out of the house of Obed-edom with joy.

26.verse: God helped the Levites carry the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, and they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.

27.verse: David was dressed in a robe made from fine linen, as were the Levites who were carrying the Ark, the singers, and Chenaniah, the director of the music. David also wore a linen ephod.

28.verse: All of Israel brought up the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord with shouting, to the sound of the horn, the trumpets, and the cymbal, and playing upon the harps and the lyres.

29.verse: As the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord came to the City of David, Michal, the daughter of Saul, was watching out the window. She saw King David dancing and playing, and she despised him in her heart.

1.verse: Chapter 16 -They brought the Ark of God and placed it inside of the tent that David had pitched for it. They offered burnt sacrifices and peace offerings before God.

2.verse: When David had finished offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.

3.verse: He gave each man and each woman in Israel one loaf of bread, a piece of meat, and a cake of raisins.

4.verse: The Levite Ministers. -He appointed some of the Levites to minister before the Ark of the Lord, to commemorate, to thank, and to praise the Lord, the God of Israel.

5.verse: They were Asaph, the leader, Zechariah, the next in charge, and Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, and Obed-edom. They were to play upon the lyres and the harps while Asaph was to play upon the cymbals.

6.verse: Benaiah and Jahaziel were the priests who normally blew the trumpets before the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord.

7.verse: On that day David first gave Asaph and his brethren this psalm of thanks to the Lord:

8.verse: Give thanks to the Lord, call upon his name;make his deeds known among the nations.

9.verse: Sing to him, praise him with song;speak of all his wondrous deeds.

10.verse: Glory in his holy name,let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.

11.verse: Seek the Lord and his strength,seek his face continually.

12.verse: Remember the marvels he has done,his wondrous deeds and the judgments of his mouth.

13.verse: O descendants of Israel, his servant,O children of Jacob, his chosen one.

14.verse: He is the Lord, our God,his judgments extend to all the earth.

15.verse: He always remembers his covenant,the word he has commanded for a thousand generations,

16.verse: which he made with Abraham,the oath he swore to Isaac.

17.verse: He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree,to Israel as an eternal covenant,

18.verse: saying, “I will give you the land of Canaan;it will be your allotted inheritance.”

19.verse: When there were only a few of them,few indeed, with foreigners among them,

20.verse: they wandered from nation to nation,from one kingdom to another people.

21.verse: He did not let anyone oppress them,for their sake he rebuked kings,

22.verse: “Do not touch my anointed;do no harm to my prophets.”

23.verse: Sing to the Lord, all the earth,proclaim his salvation from day to day.

24.verse: Declare his glory among the nations,among all nations, his marvelous deeds.

25.verse: For great is the Lord, greatly to be praised;he is to be feared more than all the other gods.

26.verse: All the gods of the nations are idols,but the Lord made the heavens.

27.verse: Glory and honor are before him,strength and joy in his dwelling place.

28.verse: Give to the Lord, O families of nations,give to the Lord glory and strength.

29.verse: Give to the Lord the glory due his name.Bring an offering and come before him;worship the Lord in holy attire.

30.verse: Tremble before him, all the earth;the world is firmly established, not to be moved.

31.verse: Let the heavens be glad, and the earth rejoice;let them say among the nations, “The Lord reigns.”

32.verse: Let the sea roar, and whatever fills it;let the fields rejoice, and all that is in them.

33.verse: The trees of the forest will sing out before the Lord,for he comes to judge the earth.

34.verse: Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;his mercy endures forever.

35.verse: Shout forth, “Save us, O Lord, our savior;gather us in and deliver us from the nations.Then we will give thanks to your holy name,we will glory in your praise.”

36.verse: Praise the Lord, the God of Israel,forever and ever.All the people said, “Amen! Praise the Lord!”

37.verse: He left Asaph and his brethren there before the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord to minister before the Ark and to do each day’s required work.

38.verse: He also left Obed-edom and sixty-eight of his brethren with them. Obed-edom, the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah were the gatekeepers.

39.verse: He also left Zadok, the priest, and his fellow priests before the tabernacle of the Lord at the high place in Gibeon.

40.verse: He was to offer the regular burnt offerings upon the altar of burnt offerings, each morning and each evening, just as it is written in the law of the Lord which he gave to Israel.

41.verse: With him there were Heman and Jeduthun and the others who had been chosen, who had been designated by name to give thanks to the Lord, for his mercy endures forever.

42.verse: Heman and Jeduthun were responsible for playing the trumpets and the cymbals as well as the other sacred musical instruments. The sons of Jeduthun were gatekeepers.

43.verse: Then all the people departed, each returning home. David, too, went home to bless his household.

1.verse: Chapter 17 -Nathan’s Oracle. -After David had moved into his palace, David said to Nathan the prophet, “Behold, I live in a house of cedar, but the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord lives under awnings.”

2.verse: Nathan said to David, “Do whatever you want to, for the Lord is with you.”

3.verse: But that same night the word of the Lord came to Nathan, saying,

4.verse: “Go and tell David my servant: Thus says the Lord, ‘You are not to build a house in which I will live.

5.verse: I have not dwelt in a house from the time that I brought Israel up from out of Egypt up to the present day. I have traveled around from one tent site to another.

6.verse: In the whole time that I have traveled around with Israel, have I ever said to any of the judges of Israel whom I commanded to shepherd my people, Why have you not built me a house made from cedar wood?’

7.verse: “Now, therefore, tell my servant David: Thus says the Lord of hosts, ‘I took you from the sheepfold, from following after the sheep, to be the ruler over my people Israel.

8.verse: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have cut down all of your enemies from before you. I have made your name famous, as famous as the great men of the earth.

9.verse: I will establish a dwelling place for my people Israel. I will plant them so that they might dwell in their own place. They will not have to move about anymore, nor shall the children of wickedness oppress them as they have done in the past,

10.verse: from the time that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. I will humble all of your enemies.“ ‘Furthermore, it is the Lord who will build you a house.

11.verse: When your days have been fulfilled and you go to be with your fathers, I will raise up your seed after you, one of your sons, and I will establish his kingdom.

12.verse: He will build a house for me, and I will establish his throne forever.

13.verse: I will be his father, and he will be my son. I will not withdraw my mercy from him, as I took it away from the one who preceded you.

14.verse: I will have him stand firm in my house forever, and his throne will be established forever.’ ”

15.verse: Nathan reported this entire vision and all of these words to David.

16.verse: David’s Prayer of Thanksgiving. -King David then went in and sat before the Lord and said, “Who am I, O Lord God, and what is my household that you have brought me to this point?

17.verse: And as if there were a small thing in your sight, O God, you have spoken about the future of your servant’s house. You have looked upon me, treating me as one who is highly exalted, O Lord God.

18.verse: What else could David say to you for honoring your servant, for you know your servant well?

19.verse: O Lord, you have done this great thing and revealed all these great things for the sake of your servant and because you have willed it.

20.verse: There is no one like you, O Lord, and there is no other God but you, as we have heard with our own ears.

21.verse: And who is like your people Israel, the one nation upon the earth whose God went forth to redeem his own people, thus making a great name for yourself, and who drove out nations with great wonders from before your people whom you redeemed out of Egypt.

22.verse: You have granted that your people, Israel, will be your own people forever, and you, O Lord, will be their God.

23.verse: “O Lord, let the things that you have spoken concerning your servant and his household now be established forever, even as you have promised.

24.verse: As it is established, so will your name be forever great. It will be said, ‘The Lord of hosts is the God of Israel, the God of Israel.’ Let the household of David, your servant, be established before you forever.

25.verse: You, O God, have revealed to your servant that you will build him a house. This is why your servant has found it in his heart to say this prayer before you.

26.verse: O Lord, you are God, and you have promised this good thing to your servant.

27.verse: Therefore, may it please you to bless the house of your servant so that it might be before you forever, for you have blessed it, O Lord, and may it be blessed forever.”

1.verse: Chapter 18 -David’s Conquests. -After this, David defeated the Philistines. He subdued Gath and took it and its dependent towns from the Philistines.

2.verse: He struck down Moab, and the Moabites became David’s vassals and brought him tribute.

3.verse: The king defeated Hadadezer, the king of Zobah up to Hamath when he went forth to establish his power along the Euphrates River.

4.verse: David took one thousand chariots from him, as well as seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand foot soldiers. David hamstrung the chariot horses, keeping one hundred chariots for himself.

5.verse: When the Arameans of Damascus came to help Hadadezer, the king of Zobah, David killed twenty-two thousand of the Arameans.

6.verse: David then stationed men in Damascus of the Arameans, and the Arameans became David’s vassals, bringing him tribute. The Lord guarded over David wherever he went.

7.verse: David took the gold shields from Hadadezer’s servants, and he brought them to Jerusalem.

8.verse: He also brought large quantities of bronze from Tibhath and Cun, Hadadezer’s cities. Solomon used the bronze to make the sea, the pillars, and vessels.

9.verse: When Tou, the king of Hamath, heard how David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer, the king of Zobah,

10.verse: he sent his son Hadoram to King David to greet him and bless him because he had fought against Hadadezer and defeated him, for Hadadezer was at war with Tou. He brought him objects of gold, silver, and bronze.

11.verse: King David dedicated them to the Lord along with the gold and the silver that he had taken from all the nations, from Edom, Moab, the Ammonites, the Philistines, and from Amalek.

12.verse: In addition to this, Abishai, the son of Zeruiah, killed eighteen thousand of the Edomites in the Valley of Salt.

13.verse: He also established outposts in Edom, so that all of Edom became David’s vassals. The Lord guarded over David wherever he went.

14.verse: David reigned over all of Israel, and he gave judgment and justice to all of his people.

15.verse: Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was the commander of the army, and Jehoshaphat, the son of Ahilud, was the archivist.

16.verse: Zadok, the son of Ahitub, and Ahimelech, the son of Abiathar, were the priests, and Shavsha was the scribe.

17.verse: Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, was in charge of the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and David’s sons were the officials of the king.

1.verse: Chapter 19 -David’s Battles with the Ammonites. -Sometime after this, Nahash, the king of the Ammonites, died, and his son reigned in his stead.

2.verse: David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun, the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent emissaries to console him with regard to his father. David’s servants came to the land of Ammon, to console Hanun.

3.verse: The Ammonite nobles said to Hanun, “Do you really think that David is honoring your father by sending men to console you? Do you not see that David has sent his servants to overthrow you and to spy out the land?”

4.verse: Hanun, therefore, seized David’s servants, shaving them and cutting their garments up to their hips. He then sent them away.

5.verse: Some men came in and told David about what had happened to the men, so he sent someone to meet them, for the men were terribly embarrassed. The king told them, “Wait at Jericho until your beards grow back, and then return.”

6.verse: The Ammonites realized that they had become abhorrent to David, so Hanun and the Ammonites sent one thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and horsemen from Mesopotamia, Aram, and Zobah.

7.verse: They hired thirty-two thousand chariots for themselves along with the king of Maacah and his people. They came and camped in front of Medeba. The Ammonites also assembled from out of their cities and went out to fight.

8.verse: David heard about this, so he sent Joab and his army of brave warriors out.

9.verse: The Ammonites came and arranged themselves in battle line at the gate to the city while the kings who had come with them stood in the fields by themselves.

10.verse: Joab saw that they were arranged in battle line both in front of him and behind him, so he chose some of the best men in Israel and placed them up against the Arameans.

11.verse: He placed the rest of the people under the command of Abishai, his brother, and they lined up against the Ammonites.

12.verse: He said, “If the Arameans are too strong for me, then you help me, but if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will help you.

13.verse: Be brave and let us be strong for our people and the cities of God. May the Lord do what he judges to be right.”

14.verse: Joab and the people who were with him drew up to fight against the Arameans, and they fled before him.

15.verse: When the Ammonites saw that the Arameans were fleeing, they also fled before Abishai, his brother. They went into the city, and Joab returned to Jerusalem.

16.verse: When the Arameans realized that they had been defeated by Israel, they sent messengers to summon the Arameans who lived beyond the river. Shophach, the commander of Hadadezer’s army, led them.

17.verse: When David was told, he gathered all of Israel together and crossed over the Jordan. He came upon them and lined up for battle against them. David set up his troops, and they fought against him.

18.verse: The Arameans fled from before David, and he slew seven thousand charioteers and forty thousand foot soldiers. He also killed Shophach, the commander of the army.

19.verse: When Hadadezer’s servants saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and became his vassals. The Arameans were no longer willing to help the Ammonites.

1.verse: Chapter 20 -In the spring of the year when kings go out to war, Joab led the army out, and he laid waste the land of the Ammonites. They came and besieged Rabbah while David stayed in Jerusalem. Joab defeated Rabbah and destroyed it.

2.verse: David took away their king’s crown. It weighed one golden talent, and there were precious stones on it. It was set upon David’s head. He also took away much spoil.

3.verse: He also took away the people who were in it. He put them to work with saws, iron picks, and axes. David did this to all of the Ammonite cities. David and all the people then returned to Jerusalem.

4.verse: Battle with the Philistines. -Sometime after this, there was a war with the Philistines at Gezer. This was when Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, who was one of the Rephaim. They were subdued.

5.verse: There was another war with the Philistines, and Elhanan, the son of Jair, killed Lahmi, the brother of Goliath the Gittite. The staff of his spear was as large was a weaver’s beam.

6.verse: There was war again at Gath where there was an enormous man who had six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot, twenty-four fingers and toes in all. He was a Rephaim.

7.verse: He taunted Israel, and Jonathan, the son of Shimea, David’s brother, killed him.

8.verse: These were born to the Rephaim in Gath, and they fell at David’s hand and those of his servants.

1.verse: Chapter 21 -The Census and Plague. -Now Satan took his stand against Israel, and he tempted David to take a census of Israel.

2.verse: David said to Joab and to the leaders of the people, “Go take a census of Israel from Beer-sheba to Dan. Bring the number to me so that I might know it.”
